definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: The hunter missed the last two shots.
sentences.chinese: 那個獵手最後兩槍沒打中。

sentences.english: We're supposed to be a pair of likely lads, just in case the slave-catchers are watching.
sentences.chinese: 我們要裝作是一對小男孩，以防努力獵手看見。

sentences.english: The hunters broke through the underbrush.
he would fly low, intentionally backfiring the plane and frightening away the hunters.
sentences.chinese: 他會飛得很低，故意讓飛機尾部噴火，嚇跑獵手。

sentences.english: Truffle "hunters" try to avoid the taxman as much as drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 松露“獵手”躲避收稅員就像毒販一樣。

sentences.english: Jess:That is your very own, certified, purebred, giant troll hunter.
sentences.chinese: 這是屬於你的，經鑑定純種的巨怪獵手。

sentences.english: The craftiest fox can't escape the skilled hunter.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸再狡猾也鬥不過好獵手。

sentences.english: Orion Orion was a giant hunter.
sentences.chinese: 奧利安是位身材高大的獵手。

sentences.english: The sportsman instantly changed his direction, and ran quickly towards them.
sentences.chinese: 那獵手立刻改變了他的方向，迅速地向他們奔來。

sentences.english: But the Kung San hunter had no cabinet nor refrigerating rooms.
sentences.chinese: 但是昆申人獵手們既沒有儲肉櫃也沒有冷藏室。
謎語變奏曲，作品36之9，獵手。

sentences.english: The hunters rode over the cornfield .
sentences.chinese: 獵手們騎着馬從麥田裏走過去。

sentences.english: There is a campaign against those hunters who mercilessly slaughter baby seals.
sentences.chinese: 一場反對那些殘酷屠殺小埃豹的獵手的運動正在展開。

sentences.english: Keesh said, "My father, Bok, was a great hunter."
sentences.chinese: 季奚說，“我的父親，青菜，是一個偉大的獵手。

definition: to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
